intro: Cyphocarpa angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf cyphocarpa, is a flowering plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
